alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 5:56AM PST until January 14 at 10:27PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... North Fork Coquille River near Myrtle Point affecting Coos County. South Fork Coquille River at Myrtle Point affecting Coos County. For the North Fork Coquille River...including Myrtle Point...Minor flooding is forecast. For the South Fork Coquille River...including Myrtle Point... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Coquille River near Myrtle Point. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Expect widespread pasture and agricultural flooding. Moderate bank erosion along the North Fork Coquille River and its tributaries can also be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Sunday the stage was 34.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 35.2 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning to 21.8 feet early Wednesday morning. It will rise to 22.2 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall to 17.6 feet Saturday afternoon. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.2 feet on 01/14/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later today around 8 PM. this evening at 900 PM PST.
